body:
### Neovim version (nvim -v)

v0.7.2

### Vim (not Nvim) behaves the same?

Not applicable: vim cannot be configured as a manpager this easily

### Operating system/version

Ubuntu 22.04 LTS

### Terminal name/version

Terminal 2.12.7 (445)

### $TERM environment variable

xterm-256color

### Installation

apt install -y neovim

### How to reproduce the issue

I'd like to use neovim to view man pages. To accomplish this, I have the following set in my `.bashrc` file:

```
export MANPAGER='nvim +Man!'
```

Opening a man page eventually comes up in neovim, but on startup for each man page brings up the following annoying message for about a second or two:

```
Error detected while processing function man#init_pager:
line   20:                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    
E302: Could not rename swap file
```

I've found that this is related to putting my swap files in `~/.vim/swap` because I prefer them there rather than polluting my working tree:

```
" Where to store swap files.  By default, they will go into ~/.vim/swap, but                                    
" if that doesn't work, they will go in cwd.                                    
set directory=~/.vim/swap,.                                     
```

Is there a way to get these two settings (using neovim as my MANPAGER and setting an alternate swap location) to work together?

This can be reproduced easily using docker:

```
docker pull ubuntu
docker run -it --name test_nvim_manpager ubuntu /bin/bash

apt update
apt install -y neovim man
unminimize

mkdir -p ~/.config/nvim
echo 'source ~/.vimrc' > ~/.config/nvim/init.vim

echo "export MANPAGER='nvim +Man\!'" >> ~/.bashrc
echo "set directory=~/.vim/swap,." >> ~/.vimrc
source ~/.bashrc

man ls

```

### Expected behavior

I expect not to be prompted with the `E302: Could not rename swap file` message.

### Actual behavior

```
Error detected while processing function man#init_pager:
line   20:                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    
E302: Could not rename swap file
```

comment_data.body: I tested this with the latest `v0.8.0` release and it happens with that as well.

title: "E302: Could not rename swap file" when using neovim as my MANPAGER with a non-default swap directory
